column4: hi, i'm trying to install some basic packages in ubuntu 64 bits version, but i can't find the major part of packages :-/
i'm using apt-cache search emacs e.g. and nothing :-/
i imagine that the major part of packages are not ported to 64 bits version, btw i'm trying to configure if not exist the package to ia64, try to install to ia32
Thats odd, Have you done an apt-get update lately?
really i install amd64 bits ubuntu version, is the same for intel 64 bits version right?
ok thanks :-) sorry but is my first computer in 64 bits and i'm lost in some options :-)
maybe is a question half offtopic, but linux kernel supports 100% quad core? ubuntu detects the 4 cores... but i don't know if the support is full or not...
i know, but my question was, if it is possible use root account and not normal account + sudo
Hm, I thought information about re-enabling root was in that link, but I must be mistaken.
You can do `sudo passwd` to set a password for root. But as you know, we dont like to suggest that. :)
is only to know how to do :-P
is incredible faster quad core in ubuntu launching xorg+gnome :-/
